Can not play LivePhoto in visitor mode
Whether to give up this photo?
Clone is a kind of funny shooting mode. Clone the moving persons and objects on the same scene through continuous shooting to create innovative images.
Shoot the same scene, (hand-held) hold your phone steady
Clone multiple identical people under the same scene

"1. Select a scene to shoot and try to keep the background overlapped. 2. Move the objects you want to clone and take 5 shots at most. 3. The system will automatically recognize the moving object and perform image registration and combination. 4. On the editing interface, use a painting brush to smear the area you want to display."
Red synthetic coverage area, through brush and eraser can adjust the display area.
Hold the camera does not move to take the first.
Shooting moving objects you want to clone the second.
Shooting moving objects you want to clone the three.
Shooting moving objects you want to clone the four, or save your photos.
Shooting moving objects you want to clone the five, or save your photos.
DNG is a kind of mainstream lossless raw image format. It preserves rich image information recorded by camera and allows for future image processing. Meanwhile it provides better image quality.
The DNG format images cannot be temporarily previewed or edited at the mobile phone end.
The default rendering of DNG format raw data in Camera Raw
The adjusted rendering of DNG format raw data in Camera Raw
Please move the phone slowly when capturing
Electronic Aperture is a kind of aperture priority shooting mode. You can get beautiful shots through long-time exposure by adjusting the electronic aperture.
"Electronic Aperture: F/44 White Balance: Auto Focus: Auto Exposure time: 87s"
"Electronic Aperture: F/22 White Balance: Auto Focus: Auto Exposure time: 18s"
White clouds, water flow, night scenes, still object, streets, etc.
This encoder type does not support video resolution
current quality do not support slow motion
The app does not have critical permissions needed to run. Please check your permissions settings.
Fusion mode is ON. Hold your phone steadly.
the fusion mode is not support effects
Fusion does not support continuous capture
Light painting, or light drawing, is a photographic technique in which exposures are made by moving a hand-held light source while taking a long exposure photograph.
Moving light source; hold your phone steady
"Shooting mode: hold the light source to depict the human body structure
"Shooting mode: hold the light source to depict letters
Auto picture snapshot turns off in Manual Focus Mode
Auto picture snapshot turns on in Manual Focus Mode
Media recorder is busy. Please close related application.
Mova o telefone continuamente na direção selecionada
HDR does not support continuous capture
No Camera was Detected. It is recommended to contact the customer service for processing
Align picture error, please move the phone in horizontal direction

No PRO e PHOTO adaptado para melhores dimensões ao fazer zoom.
Here we will briefly describe nubia camera’s basic functions and operation instructions to help you flexibly use these photographing skills.
Quick Start Guide to your nubia camera
the current video quality is not support effects
record fail because it is too short!
Slow shutter is a kind of shooting mode in dark light. You can shoot clear night scenes by prolonging the exposure time.
Shoot under the scenes without enough light or dark night; hold your phone steady
"Shutter speed: 5s ISO: 100 White Balance: Auto Focus: Auto"
"Shutter speed: 7s ISO: 100 White Balance: 5000K Manual focus: Infinite"
Light track, night scenes, starry sky, flash, etc.
Make the image clear through detecting the position of the object.
Auto Focus is set as default when the camera is started. Auto Focus can quickly and accurately determine the position of the object and make the image clear.
Purpose: make sure the focus point of the object is consistent during continuous shooting
"Macro Photography High-speed continuous shooting Self-timer continuous shooting"
Purpose: manually adjust the focus value to make the image of a object from a specific distance clear.
During the process of manual focus, the most concentrated area of red peak values in the following figure are clear focus points. It can help photographers to achieve more accurate focus.
When shooting, observe the red peak value to determine the focus point on the image.
The following shows the image taken. (enlarged partially)
"Macro Photography Transparent glass windows Dark light, Night scene, Starry sky, etc."
What ISO denotes is how sensitive the image sensor is to the amount of light present. The higher the ISO is, the more light the camera sensor absorbs.

See the following photo examples. The higher ISO you select, the more noise it will generate. Selecting lower ISO can guarantee better image quality, but you need reduce the shutter speed (increase shooting time) to get reasonable exposure.
Get accurate exposure through detecting the luminance of the photographing scene. In different metering modes, the metering range and scene adaptability are somewhat different.
Auto Metering is set as default when the camera is started. It is a kind of mode, which gives consideration to the overall image luminance. In most scenes, it can help you get accurate exposure.
Separate metering mode takes effect after separating from the focus frame. Perform separate metering to the selected area only. And allow the area to quickly get accurate exposure.
Move the metering frame to make the sunset get accurate exposure.
Purpose: make sure the exposure is consistent at the same luminance during continuous shooting.
Backlight or complicated light environment.Long-term time-lapse photography.
Based on separate metering, adjust the exposure compensation at your will to change the image brightness/darkness.

Under complicated light environment, you can adjust the exposure compensation to avoid underexposure or overexposure when the exposure is not accurate; you can also adjust the exposure compensation to get brighter or darker shooting effect when the exposure is reasonable.
The ceramics under the light is overexposed.
After metering, lower the exposure compensation.
"Backlight or complicated light environment Cloudy, Misty, Rainy and Snowy weather"
Shutter speed is the length of time when the image sensor inside the camera is exposed to light, e.g., 1/1600s, 1/300s, 1s, 10s, etc.

Fast shutter speeds can be used to shoot fast moving objects or high-luminance scenes; while slow shutter speeds can be used to shoot the scenes without enough light; During the shooting process, shutter speed should be flexibly adjusted with ISO to avoid image underexposure or overexposure.
The variation of exposure time indicates different states of the shooting object.1/400s exposure time, freeze the moving cars and persons.
2s exposure time, record the track of moving vehicle lights.
When the exposure time is larger than 1/15s, a slight jitter of your hands will cause image blurring. Therefore you need use a tripod or other stabilization method to shoot.
Bulb, Electronic Aperture, Light Painting, Star Trail, Self-timer Continuous Shooting, etc.
Check the stability of your device before shooting and use a countdown timer during the photographing process.
Restore real colors of the object through detecting the light source of the scene.
Auto WB is set as default when the camera is started. In most scenes, it can help you restore real colors of the object.
Compensate the light source by selecting[Incandescent][Fluorescent][Sunlight][Overcast] or[Shadow]to get the best color restoration.

Example: the color temperature of Incandescent lamp is about 3000K; the image taken under 3000K is inclined to a reddish or orange color. The camera will eliminate some warm light under[Incandescent]mode to make the image adapt to the visual habits of human eyes since the camera does not adapt to the uniqueness of human eyes.

1. If the preset WB is a low value, such as [Incandescent], the camera will eliminate some warm light to make the image incline to cool or neutral colors. On the contrary, in [Shadow]mode, the camera will eliminate some cool light to make the image incline to warm or neutral colors.
2. Know about the work principle of White Balance and skillfully use it. In the following figure, you can create different photographing effects by adjusting the preset WB.
When you select[Incandescent]to shoot, the image will present cool colors.
When you select[Overcast]to shoot, the image will present warm colors.

After you have manually selected the color of some area on the image, the camera will carry out reverse compensation according to the selected color to adjust the image colors. You can select different colors to offset White Balance to get colorful image effects.
Purpose: make sure the colors are consistent at the same luminance during continuous shooting.

All the stars rise in the east and set in the west due to the Earth’s daily spin. With Star Trail Camera, you can shoot clear and bright starry sky and long-time record the moving track of spectacular sky.
Shoot under sunny sky, avoid the influence caused by strong light; hold your phone steady
"Shutter speed: 60s ISO: 1600 White Balance: 3500k Manual focus: Infinite Total exposure time: 12,540 seconds (about 3.5h)"
"Shutter speed: 50s ISO: 1600 White Balance: Auto Manual focus: Infinite Total exposure time: 15,450 seconds (about 4.3h)"
Por favor, reclick para cancelar tirando esta foto
Por favor, reclick para salvar esta foto

With 3D & 360 ° camera, you rotate the phone to take more than one pictures from different viewing angles. All these pictures and the 3D dynamic information will be integrated into an interactive 3D dynamic picture. Then rotate your phone to see the whole view of the 3D dynamic picture.
3D object: hold your phone and rotate it around the object to shoot
Panorama: hold and move your phone to shoot from broad view
Single object, Landscape, big party, etc.
Turn the phone smoothly after shooting
Not available in the current mode
Toque na tela para acordar a câmera
Time shuttle is an creative camera which has two effects. Choose Diffuse & Blur and you will have a clear subject with flowing background. Choose Overlay & Radiate to get strong visual shock.
Diffuse & Blur: when you have an obvious center object
Overlay & Radiate: City light, alphabets, line pattern, etc.
